result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas B. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Reckless Probab./Great Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: With work release/Huber privileges. * JOC AMENDED 7/11/18 so that the Defendant may serve his imposed and stayed jail sentences in Sauk County. Per the "Stipulation and Order to Modify JOC" filed with the Richland County Clerk of Court on 7/11/18, The Defendant's probation in this case has been revoked.

Conditions: 
No contact with victim except pursuant to a family court order.

Def is to obey rules & regs of probation.

Def is to attend, pay for and successfully complete all treatment recommendations as made by agent.

Def is to pay the costs of action and costs of probation. 

Def is to submit a DNA sample and Court will remit the surcharge. 

Def is eligible for expungement under statute 973.015 upon successful completion of probation. (def is to contact the Clerk of Court).

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: (See Information)

2 cases called together (14CF103 & 15CF16). Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court with Defendant Nicholas B. Brown. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution, state agreement to Court. 14CF103 charge is amended to 948.03(3)(c). Colloquy re prelim waiver. Court accepts def's waiver, binds def over for trial. Information filed. 15CF16 colloquy re. plea waiver (as charged). Court accepts waiver, binds def over for trial.  Colloquy on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights on both matters. NC pleas entered on both charges. Court finds factual basis and accepts pleas, finds def guilty. 

Sentencing: 

14CF103-count 1 as amended to 948.03(3)(c). 12 months county jail with work release privileges, imposed and stayed for 3 years probation. Conditions: No contact with victim except pursuant to a family court order,  obey rules & regs of probation, attend, pay for and successfully complete all treatment recommendations as made by agent. def is to pay the costs of action and costs of probation, def is to submit a DNA sample and Court will remit the surcharge. Def is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation. (def is to contact the Clerk of Court). 

15CF16: 12 months county jail with work release imposed and stayed for 3 years probation concurrent to 14CF103. Conditions:  Def is to pay the costs of action and costs of probation, obey rules & regs of probation, attend, pay for and successfully complete all treatment recommendations as made by agent. def is to submit a DNA sample and Court will remit the surcharge. Def is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation. (def is to contact the Clerk of Court)
